00057 /*****************************************************************************/
00058 /**
00059  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::TranslationInputStreamTableModel
00060  * Synopsis:
00061  *
00062  * CHP constructor.
00063  *
00064  * Note that most CHP data is completely ignored excepting the alleles
00065  * and the probe set id.
00066  * Be only using three pieces of  CHP data from the CHP file
00067  * (probe set id, allele1 and allele2) allows the design to be coallece CHP
00068  * files into the TSV data model for the DMET2, Genotype Short Report.
00069  * This is signficant because research
00070  * at Affy after DMET3 is release will able to use the Genotype Short Report
00071  * input for DMET3. Creaing text files of sample data can be done in Excel
00072  *  and this avoids creating CHP files soley for the purpose of
00073  *  running this translation program. 
00074  * 
00075  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment.
00076  * @param tsvColumnDefinitions  - CHP data is coerced into TSV fields. 
00077  * @param tcdSize - size of tsvColumnDefinitions
00078  * @param gotm  - the genotype override table model.
00079  *
00080  */
00081 /*****************************************************************************/
00082 TranslationInputStreamTableModel::TranslationInputStreamTableModel(
00083   const RunTimeEnvironment& rte,
00084   const TittmColumnDefinition tsvColumnDefinitions[],
00085   size_t tcdSize,
00086   GenotypeOverrideTableModel *gotm) : m_gotm(gotm)
00087 {
00088 
00089   m_type                 = ADT_EXPERIMENT_STREAM_TYPE_CHP;
00090   m_chpData              = NULL;
00091   m_genoCallCoder        = NULL;
00092 
00093   _initializeColumnDefinitions(rte, tsvColumnDefinitions, tcdSize);
00094 
00095 
00096   // Ok, we shouldn't be trapping this exception here, but
00097   // during the input validation. This is a programming error
00098   // so just assert.
00099   APT_ERR_ASSERT(rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputExperimentFiles.size() != 0, "");
00100 
00101   for (size_t i = 0; i < rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputExperimentFiles.size(); i++) {
00102     m_chpExperimentFileQueue.push_back(
00103       rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputExperimentFiles[i]);
00104   }
00105 
00106 
00107   return;
00108 
00109 }
00110 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::TranslationInputStreamTableModel

00113 /**
00114  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::TranslationInputStreamTableModel
00115  * Synopsis:
00116  *
00117  * Tsv constructor.
00118  *
00119  * A DMET2 constructor for the Genotype Short Report input of genotype
00120  * data. The schema for this object is the schema for the Genotype Short
00121  * Report even for CHP files. 
00122  *
00123  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment. 
00124  * @param inputTsvFileName - the file with the Genotype Short Report data. 
00125  * @param tsvColumnDefinitions - the Genotype Short Report columns
00126  * @param tcdSize - the tsvColumnDefinitions size
00127  * @param strictTsvColumnOrder - when true the columns must be in order. 
00128  * @param tsvExperimentColumn - if column order is not strict, which column contains the experiment. 
00129  * @param tsvGeneColumn - if column order is not strict, which column contains the gene. 
00130  * @param tsvProbeSetColumn - if column order is not strict, which column contains the probe set id.. 
00131  * @param gotm - the single instance Genotype Override Table Model.
00132  *
00133  */
00134 /*****************************************************************************/
00135 TranslationInputStreamTableModel::TranslationInputStreamTableModel(
00136   const RunTimeEnvironment& rte,
00137   const std::string& inputTsvFileName,
00138   const TittmColumnDefinition tsvColumnDefinitions[],
00139   size_t tcdSize,
00140   bool strictTsvColumnOrder,
00141   int tsvExperimentColumn,
00142   int tsvGeneColumn,
00143   int tsvProbeSetColumn,
00144   GenotypeOverrideTableModel *gotm) : m_gotm(gotm)
00145 {
00146 
00147   m_type                 = ADT_EXPERIMENT_STREAM_TYPE_TSV;
00148   m_strictTsvColumnOrder = strictTsvColumnOrder;
00149   m_tsvExperimentColumn  = tsvExperimentColumn;
00150   m_tsvGeneColumn        = tsvGeneColumn;
00151   m_tsvFileName          = inputTsvFileName;
00152   m_tsvProbeSetColumn    = tsvProbeSetColumn;
00153   m_chpData              = NULL;
00154   m_genoCallCoder        = NULL;
00155 
00156   _initializeColumnDefinitions(rte, tsvColumnDefinitions, tcdSize);
00157 
00158 
00159   _openTsvFile(rte);
00160 
00161 
00162 }
00163 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::TranslationInputStreamTableModel

00166 /**
00167  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::columnCount
00168  * Synopsis:
00169  * 
00170  * Interogate an already instantiated table for the number of columns.
00171  * This method assumes ALL rows have the same column width and just
00172  * returns the width of the column defintion structure. .
00173  *
00174  */
00175 /*****************************************************************************/
00176 int TranslationInputStreamTableModel::columnCount() const
00177 {
00178 
00179   if (m_tsvColumnDefinition.size()  > 0) {
00180     return m_tsvColumnDefinition.size();
00181   }
00182 
00183   return 0;
00184 
00185 }
00186 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::columnCount

00189 /**
00190  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::clearData
00191  * Synopsis
00192  * 
00193  * It is required that memory usage should constant as files and
00194  * experiments are streamed. This method resets the object to
00195  * no data other than the meta data required to open the next stream
00196  * (file). 
00197  *
00198  * Calls to this API should clear all memory in between experiments.
00199  *
00200  */
00201 /*****************************************************************************/
00202 void  TranslationInputStreamTableModel::clearData()
00203 {
00204 
00205   m_rows.clear() ;
00206 
00207   if (m_chpData != NULL) {
00208     delete m_chpData;
00209     m_chpData = NULL;
00210   }
00211 
00212 
00213   return;
00214 
00215 }
00216 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::clearData

00219 /**
00220  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::getColumnName
00221  * Synopsis:
00222  *
00223  * Get the column name for a column index, i.e. integer -> std::string.
00224  * It's an assertion error to pass in an out of bound index. 
00225  *
00226  * @param column - the 0 based column index for the column in question.
00227  * 
00228  * @return m_columnName - the name corresponding to column. 
00229  */
00230 /*****************************************************************************/
00231 std::string TranslationInputStreamTableModel::getColumnName(int column)
00232 {
00233 
00234   // This should always be true unless some constructor is created
00235   // that doesn't initialize this.
00236   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_tsvColumnDefinition.size(), "");
00237 
00238   APT_ERR_ASSERT((column >= 0) && (column < columnCount()), "");
00239 
00240   return m_tsvColumnDefinition[column].m_columnName;
00241 
00242 }
00243 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::getColumnName
00244 /*****************************************************************************/

00246 /**
00247  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::getRowAsString
00248  * Synopsis:
00249  * 
00250  * Debug convienance routine that std::stringifies and entire row. Also
00251  * used in error messages. All columns are "separated" by a single comma.
00252  * If the data within a column contains a column there is no attempt made
00253  * quote the columns. Empty columns will have comma sequences as ",,,". 
00254  * column 1 2   3 
00255  * data   A B,C D => "A,B,C,D"
00256  * 
00257  * @param row - integer of the row, 0 based
00258  * 
00259  * @return std::string - the comma separated std::string
00260  */
00261 /*****************************************************************************/
00262 std::string TranslationInputStreamTableModel::getRowAsString(const int row)  const
00263 {
00264 
00265   APT_ERR_ASSERT((row >= 0) && (row < size()), "");
00266 
00267   std::stringstream rowSStr;
00268 
00269   for (int j = 0 ; j < columnCount(); j++) {
00270     rowSStr << m_rows[row][j];
00271 
00272     if (j < (columnCount() - 1)) {
00273       rowSStr << ",";
00274     }
00275 
00276   } // for each column
00277 
00278   return rowSStr.str();
00279 
00280 }
00281 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::getRowAsString

00284 /**
00285  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::readNextExperiment:
00286  * Synopsis:
00287  *
00288  *  A wrapper that wraps the appropriate TSV for CHP read next experiment
00289  * method. The TranslationEngine calls this method.       
00290  *
00291  * 
00292  * 
00293  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment. 
00294  * @param ttm - the single instance translation table model. 
00295  * @param geneExperimentCopyNumberCall
00296  *            - The copy number 0 designation per gene std::map. 
00297  * 
00298  * @return - the number of records read or 0 if no more records are left.
00299  */
00300 /*****************************************************************************/
00301 int TranslationInputStreamTableModel::readNextExperiment(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, TranslationTableModel & ttm, const std::map< std::string, std::string> & geneExperimentCopyNumberCall, std::map< std::string, int> & geneCopyNumber)
00302 {
00303 
00304 
00305   if (m_type == ADT_EXPERIMENT_STREAM_TYPE_TSV) {
00306     return _readNextExperimentTsv(rte, ttm, geneExperimentCopyNumberCall);
00307   } else if (m_type == ADT_EXPERIMENT_STREAM_TYPE_CHP) {
00308     return _readNextExperimentCHP(rte, ttm, geneExperimentCopyNumberCall, geneCopyNumber );
00309   }
00310 
00311   return 0;
00312 
00313 }
00314 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::readNextExperiment
00315 /*****************************************************************************/
00316 /*****************************************************************************/
00317 /**
00318  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::sortTsvFileByExperiment:
00319  * Synopsis:
00320  *
00321  * Genotype Short Report files are NOT sorted by experiment, but need
00322  * to be in order to be streamed. If this program detects an unsorted
00323  * Genotype Short Report then it aborts. However, before it aborts
00324  * it sorts the TSV file and creates a new copy of the file
00325  * with ".sorted" as an extension. In this way the user can
00326  * simply call the program a second time using the ".sorted" file
00327  * and then continue on. 
00328  * 
00329  * This is utility routine used independent of translating calls. Use this
00330  * routine with its own option switch as a convienance to sort
00331  * an input genotype short report file. Sorting is a requirement
00332  * for streaming. 
00333  *
00334  *
00335  * @rte - the single instance RunTimeEnvironment which contains the name of the file to be sorted. 
00336  *
00337  * @return - void, creates a new file of sorted records. Throws exceptions
00338  *           on IO errors.
00339  */
00340 /*****************************************************************************/
00341 void TranslationInputStreamTableModel::sortTsvFileByExperiment(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte)
00342 {
00343 
00344   // This should never happen unless a new constructor is created
00345   // that doesn't initialize columns.
00346   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_tsvColumnDefinition.size(), "");
00347 
00348   TsvFile sortTsv;
00349 
00350   std::string sortName = m_tsvFileName + ".sort.txt";
00351 
00352   Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, "sortTsvFileByExperiment: " + m_tsvFileName
00353                +  " -> " + sortName);
00354 
00355   for (size_t i = 0; i < m_tsvColumnDefinition.size(); i++) {
00356 
00357     sortTsv.defineColumn(0, i, m_tsvColumnDefinition[i].m_columnName);
00358   }
00359 
00360   //
00361   m_tsv.m_optAutoTrim   = true; // remove '"'s
00362   m_tsv.m_optQuoteChar1 = 0;    // ignore "'"s
00363 
00364 
00365   if (m_tsv.open(m_tsvFileName) != TSV_OK) {
00366     APT_ERR_ABORT(m_tsvFileName + ": failed opening input Tsv file.");
00367   }
00368 
00369   m_tsv.headersBegin();
00370 
00371   std::string key;
00372   std::string value;
00373   sortTsv.addHeaderComment(" File generated by sortTsvFileByExperiment.");
00374   while (m_tsv.headersNext(key, value) == TSV_OK) {
00375     sortTsv.addHeader(key, value);
00376   }
00377 
00378   sortTsv.writeTsv_v1(sortName);
00379 
00380   int row = 0;
00381   while (m_tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00382 
00383     m_rows.resize(row + 1);
00384     m_rows[row].resize(m_tsvColumnCount, "");
00385 
00386     // Read in a row, one column at a time.
00387     for (int tsvColumn = 0; tsvColumn < m_tsvColumnCount; tsvColumn++) {
00388       std::string columnValue;
00389       if (m_tsv.get(0, tsvColumn, columnValue) != TSV_OK) {
00390         APT_ERR_ABORT("tsv.get != TSV_OK");
00391       }
00392       if (!columnValue.empty()) {
00393         m_rows[row][m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]] = columnValue;
00394       }
00395     }
00396 
00397     m_experimentRowIndex[m_rows[row][m_tsvExperimentColumn]].push_back(row);
00398     row++;
00399   }
00400 
00401   std::map<std::string, std::vector< int > >::iterator itSV;
00402 
00403   row = 0;
00404   for (itSV = m_experimentRowIndex.begin(); itSV != m_experimentRowIndex.end(); itSV++) {
00405 
00406     for (size_t i = 0; i < itSV->second.size() ; i++) {
00407       for (int tsvColumn = 0; tsvColumn < m_tsvColumnCount; tsvColumn++) {
00408         sortTsv.set(0, tsvColumn,  m_rows[itSV->second[i]][tsvColumn]);
00409       }
00410       sortTsv.writeLevel(0);
00411       row++;
00412     }
00413   }
00414 
00415   Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, ToStr(row) + " sorted Genotype records written to " + sortName);
00416 
00417   sortTsv.close();
00418 
00419   m_tsv.close();
00420 
00421   clearData();
00422 
00423   return;
00424 
00425 }
00426 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::sortTsvFileByExperiment

00449 /*****************************************************************************/
00450 /*****************************************************************************/
00451 /**
00452  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getAllelesFromProbeSet:
00453  * Synopsis:
00454  *
00455  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentCHP
00456  *
00457  * Translates a probe set id's textual 'allele1' and 'allele2'
00458  * from the CHP file using the APIs found in the GenoCallCoder. 
00459  *
00460  *  The CHP calls are encoded as "A/A" or "A/B" or "B/B", etc. These
00461  *  need to be translated into the actual alleles in the annotation file.
00462  *  Do the look up in the GenoCallCoder and return the bases.
00463  * 
00464  * Note: the report alleles are not retrieved here but instead are
00465  * imported at start up time using all the probe sets and alleles in the
00466  * translation table.
00467  *
00468  * Also note: the CHP will contain many more probe sets then are defined in
00469  * the translation table. When this API returns false then this is
00470  * the deciding factor when to ignore a probe set marker in the
00471  * CHP file and the data is dropped on the floor. 
00472  *
00473  * @param rte - the single instance RunTimeEnvironment.
00474  * @param ttm - the single instance translation table.
00475  * @param dbad - the DmetBiAllelicData with probe set and call data.
00476  *               Note: BiAllelic is a misnomer, multi allelic is represented as
00477  *               well.
00478  * @param genoCallDecoder - the object that does translation from "A/A" -> "TGT/TTT".
00479  * @param allele1 - returned base for the ALLELE1 column.
00480  * @param allele2 - returned base for the ALLELE2 column.
00481  *
00482  * @return - true if the probeSet exists  in the translation table,
00483  *           the allele1 and allele2 std::strings
00484  */
00485 /*****************************************************************************/
00486 bool TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getAllelesFromProbeSet(const class RunTimeEnvironment & rte, TranslationTableModel & ttm,  affymetrix_calvin_data::DmetBiAllelicData & dbad,  std::string & allele1, std::string & allele2)
00487 {
00488 
00489 
00490 
00491   APT_ERR_ASSERT(!dbad.name.empty(), "");
00492 
00493   std::string probeSet    = dbad.name;
00494 
00495   if (ttm.m_probeSetRowIndex.count(probeSet) == 0) {
00496     return false;
00497   }
00498 
00499 
00500   std::string decodedAbstractCall;
00501   std::string decodedCall;
00502   std::string reportCall;
00503 
00504   allele1.clear();
00505   allele2.clear();
00506 
00507   bool probeSetSwitchStrand = ((ttm.getType() == ADT_TRANSLATION_TABLE_TYPE_DMET3) && ttm.m_rows[ttm.m_probeSetRowIndex[probeSet][0]][ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_SWITCH_STRAND)] == "Y");
00508 
00509 
00510   decodedCall = m_genoCallCoder->genotypeCallNumToReferenceAllele(probeSet, dbad.call);
00511 
00512   if (decodedCall.empty()) {
00513     APT_ERR_ABORT("Empty reference call returned by abstractAlleleToReferenceAllele.");
00514   }
00515 
00516   std::string first, second, copyNumber;
00517 
00518 
00519   if (!pcrecpp::RE("^([\\w\\d\\-]+)$").FullMatch(decodedCall, &first)) {
00520 
00521     if (! pcrecpp::RE("^(\\w+|\\-)/(\\w+|\\-)$").FullMatch(decodedCall, &first, &second)) {
00522       APT_ERR_ABORT(probeSet + ": unknown call? " + decodedCall);
00523     }
00524   }
00525 
00526   // Copy Number 0 translation
00527 
00528   if ((first == "17") || (first == "ZeroCopyNumber")) {
00529     first = "0";
00530   }
00531 
00532   allele1 = first;
00533 
00534   if (first == "NotAvailable") {
00535     // Returning false causes the marker to be ignored, exactly the behavior
00536     // required.
00537     //    return false;
00538   }
00539 
00540   if (!second.empty()) {
00541     allele2 = second;
00542   }
00543 
00544 
00545   if (probeSetSwitchStrand) {
00546 
00547     allele1 = CallElement::reverseComplement(allele1);
00548     allele2 = CallElement::reverseComplement(allele2);
00549 
00550   }
00551 
00552   return true;
00553 
00554 }
00555 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getAllelesFromProbeSet
00556 /*****************************************************************************/
00557 /*****************************************************************************/
00558 /**
00559  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getGeneFromProbeSet:
00560  * Synopsis:
00561  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentCHP
00562  *
00563  * The CHP file doesn't contain the gene. However, the assay id (probe set)
00564  * is distinct per translation table so it can be looked up in the
00565  * translation table.
00566  *
00567  * @param probeSet - the marker for which to get the gene
00568  * @param ttm - the single instance translation table containing the gene
00569  *
00570  * @return - gene as std::string, empty if the probeSet doesn't exist
00571  */
00572 /*****************************************************************************/
00573 std::string TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getGeneFromProbeSet(const std::string probeSet,   const TranslationTableModel & ttm)
00574 {
00575 
00576   std::string gene;
00577 
00578   if (ttm.getProbeSetRowIndex(probeSet) < 0) {
00579     return gene;
00580   }
00581 
00582   gene = ttm.m_rows[ttm.getProbeSetRowIndex(probeSet)][ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_GENE)];
00583 
00584   return gene;
00585 }
00586 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getGeneFromProbeSet
00587 /*****************************************************************************/
00588 /*****************************************************************************/
00589 /**
00590  * searchParams
00591  * Synopsis:
00592  *
00593  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getCHPGuid and
00594  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeNextExperimentCHPFile.
00595  *
00596  * The calvin_files directory contains APIs to search for headers  or
00597  * parameters in the CHP file's various inheritance tree. However, these
00598  * APIs are specific the the class implemented for. This search
00599  * searchs the entire inheritance graph in one convienant API.
00600  * This function also convienantly handles all the conversion from
00601  * WCS to std::string. 
00602  *
00603  * Note: This is not the most efficient API but the two functions
00604  * being helped are
00605  * initialization functions only used at start up and hence performance
00606  * is not a factor. 
00607  *
00608  * @param gdh - GenericDataHeader from m_chpData
00609  * @params searchName - what to search for.
00610  * @params searchValue - the return value. 
00611  *
00612  * @return - searchValue, if found
00613  */
00614 /*****************************************************************************/
00615 static void searchParams(affymetrix_calvin_io::GenericDataHeader & gdh, const std::string searchName ,  std::string &searchValue )
00616 {
00617 
00618   if (!searchValue.empty()) {
00619     return;
00620   }
00621 
00622   ParameterNameValueTypeIt itPNVT;
00623   ParameterNameValueTypeIt jtPNVT;
00624 
00625   gdh.GetNameValIterators(itPNVT, jtPNVT);
00626 
00627   for (; itPNVT != jtPNVT; itPNVT++) {
00628 
00629     if (StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(itPNVT->GetName()) == searchName ) {
00630       searchValue = StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(itPNVT->ToString());
00631       return;
00632     }
00633   }
00634 
00635   std::vector<GenericDataHeader>::iterator itGDH;
00636   std::vector<GenericDataHeader>::iterator jtGDH;
00637 
00638   gdh.GetParentIterators(itGDH, jtGDH);
00639 
00640   for (; itGDH != jtGDH ; itGDH++) {
00641     searchParams(*itGDH, searchName, searchValue);
00642   }
00643 
00644   return;
00645 
00646 }
00647 // end searchParams
00648 /*****************************************************************************/
00649 /*****************************************************************************/
00650 /**
00651  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getCHPGuid:
00652  * Synopsis:
00653  *
00654  * Helper function to _initializeNextExperimentCHPFile
00655  * 
00656  *   Returns the CHP file assay id. Broken out due to confusion about
00657  * which GUID is the right guid. Also, some prototype CHP files stuff
00658  * the GUID in a different place than that required by the 
00659  * canonical gd.ArrayIdentifier(). If gd.ArrayIdentifier fails then
00660  * searchParams is called. Only prototype CHPS files have exhibited this
00661  * behavior. 
00662  *
00663  * 
00664  * 
00665  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment. 
00666  * @param gd - GenericData from m_chpData
00667  * 
00668  * @return - guid, The GUID std::string.
00669  */
00670 /*****************************************************************************/
00671 /*****************************************************************************/
00672 std::string TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getCHPGuid(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, affymetrix_calvin_io::GenericData & gd)
00673 {
00674 
00675 
00676   //m_chpGuid = m_chpData->GetFileHeader()->GetGenericDataHdr()->GetFileId();
00677   //m_chpGuid = gd.ArrayIdentifier();
00678 
00679   AffymetrixGuidType guid;
00680 
00681   guid = gd.ArrayIdentifier();
00682 
00683 
00684   if (guid.empty()) {
00685     GenericDataHeader* gdh = gd.Header().GetGenericDataHdr();
00686 
00687     if (gdh  == NULL)  {
00688       APT_ERR_ABORT("Can't find header: " + ToStr(ARRAY_TYPE_IDENTIFIER));
00689     }
00690     searchParams(*gdh, StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(ARRAY_ID_PARAM_NAME) ,guid);
00691     if (guid.empty()) {
00692       APT_ERR_ABORT(m_chpExperimentFile + ": invalid CHP file, missing Array ID GUID (" + ToStr(ARRAY_TYPE_IDENTIFIER) + ").");
00693     }
00694   }
00695 
00696   return guid;
00697 
00698 }
00699 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getCHPGuid
00700 /*****************************************************************************/
00701 /*****************************************************************************/
00702 /**
00703  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getExternalIdFromProbeSet:
00704  * Synopsis:
00705  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentCHP
00706  *
00707  * The CHP file doesn't contain the external id. However, the probe set id
00708  * is distinct per translation table so it can be looked up in the
00709  * translation table.
00710  *
00711  * @param probeSet - the marker
00712  * @param ttm      - the single instance translation table
00713  *
00714  * @return - external id (common name)  as std::string, empty if the probeSet doesn't exist
00715  */
00716 /*****************************************************************************/
00717 std::string TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getExternalIdFromProbeSet(const std::string probeSet,   const TranslationTableModel & ttm)
00718 {
00719 
00720   std::string externalId;
00721 
00722   if (ttm.getProbeSetRowIndex(probeSet) < 0) {
00723     return externalId;
00724   }
00725 
00726   externalId = ttm.m_rows[ttm.getProbeSetRowIndex(probeSet)][ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_COMMON_NAME)];
00727 
00728   return externalId;
00729 }
00730 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_getExternalIdFromProbeSet
00731 /*****************************************************************************/
00732 /*****************************************************************************/
00733 /**
00734  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeColumnDefinitions
00735  * Synopsis: 
00736  *
00737  * Helper function to the constructers
00738  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::TranslationInputStreamTableModel
00739  * 
00740  * Initialize the definition of columns data structure. This is compared
00741  * against the input TSV file when it is opened for integrity. 
00742  * 
00743  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment. 
00744  * @param columnDefinitions - the typically hard coded columns. 
00745  * @param tcdSize - the size of columnDefinitions. 
00746  *
00747  */
00748 /*****************************************************************************/
00749 void TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeColumnDefinitions(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, const TittmColumnDefinition columnDefinitions[], int tcdSize)
00750 {
00751 
00752   m_tsvColumnDefinition.clear();
00753 
00754   // Iterate so we can doublecheck the m_index value.
00755   for (int i = 0; i < tcdSize; i++) {
00756 
00757     APT_ERR_ASSERT(columnDefinitions[i].m_index == i, "");
00758 
00759     m_tsvColumnDefinition.push_back(columnDefinitions[i]);
00760   }
00761 
00762   return;
00763 }
00764 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeColumnDefinitions
00765 /*****************************************************************************/
00766 /*****************************************************************************/
00767 /**
00768  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeNextExperimentCHPFile:
00769  * Synopsis:
00770  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentCHP
00771  * 
00772  * Open the next CHP file, read the headers and postion things to read the
00773  * first data record.
00774  *
00775  * Initialize the global report alleles.
00776  * The report alleles global to all experiments are 
00777  * initialized here. There are two reasons for this:
00778  * 1.) The GenoCallCoder requires parameters taken from a CHP file
00779  * specific to this set of CHP files.
00780  * 2.) The first CHP file is read for the first time here. The parameters
00781  * are take from that file here. 
00782  * 
00783  *
00784  * @param rte - the RunTimeEnvironment with the command line list
00785  *              of all the experiment CHP files.
00786  * @param ttm - the single instance translation table model updated with the
00787  * report alleles on the first call. 
00788  *
00789  * @return - true if ok, false otherwise. Throws Exception on IO error. Updates the ttm with the report alleles on first call. 
00790  */
00791 /*****************************************************************************/
00792 bool TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeNextExperimentCHPFile(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, TranslationTableModel & ttm)
00793 {
00794 
00795   bool okToContinue = true;
00796 
00797   if (m_chpExperimentFileQueue.size() == 0) {
00798     return false;
00799   }
00800 
00801   m_chpExperimentFile = m_chpExperimentFileQueue.front();
00802   m_chpExperimentFileQueue.pop_front();
00803 
00804 
00805   // Open the file and read the headers.
00806   // I traced this "Read" call back to GenericFileReader.cpp
00807   // and "Read" only reads the headers.
00808 
00809 
00810   m_chpData = new affymetrix_calvin_io::CHPMultiDataData;
00811 
00812   affymetrix_calvin_io::CHPMultiDataFileReader reader;
00813   reader.SetFilename(m_chpExperimentFile);
00814 
00815   reader.Read(*m_chpData);
00816 
00817   FileHeader *chpFileHeader = m_chpData->GetFileHeader();
00818 
00819   DataGroupHdrIt itDG, jtDG;
00820 
00821   chpFileHeader->GetDataGroupIts(itDG, jtDG);
00822 
00823   for (; itDG != jtDG; itDG++) {
00824 
00825     DataSetHdrIt itDSH, jtDSH;
00826 
00827     itDG->GetDataSetIterators(itDSH, jtDSH);
00828 
00829   }
00830 
00831   ParameterNameValueTypeList summaryList = m_chpData->GetSummaryParams();
00832 
00833 
00834   ParameterNameValueTypeList::iterator  itPNV;
00835 
00836   for (itPNV = summaryList.begin(); itPNV != summaryList.end(); itPNV++) {
00837     std::string name = StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(itPNV->GetName());
00838   }
00839 
00840   ParameterNameValueTypeList algorithmList = m_chpData->GetAlgParams();
00841 
00842   GenericData & gd = m_chpData->GetGenericData();
00843 
00844   WStringVector names;
00845   gd.DataGroupNames(names);
00846 
00847   for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
00848 
00849     std::string dataTypeName = StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(MultiDataDataSetNames[ADT_CHP_DATA_TYPES[i]]);
00850 
00851     m_chpDataTypeSize[ADT_CHP_DATA_TYPES[i]] = m_chpData->GetEntryCount(ADT_CHP_DATA_TYPES[i]);
00852 
00853     if (m_chpDataTypeSize[ADT_CHP_DATA_TYPES[i]] == 0) {
00854       Verbose::warn(ADT_VERBOSE_EXCEPTION, dataTypeName  + ": group has no records (0 size)\n");
00855     }
00856 
00857   }
00858 
00859   // EXPERIMENT NAME, set to the file name, minus directories
00860   m_experimentName = Fs::basename(m_chpExperimentFile);
00861   bool okMatch = pcrecpp::RE("\\.[cC][hH][Pp]$").PartialMatch(m_experimentName);
00862 
00863   APT_ERR_ASSERT(okMatch, "");
00864 
00865   if (m_experimentName.empty()) {
00866     APT_ERR_ABORT(m_chpExperimentFile + ": invalid experiment file name.");
00867   }
00868 
00869   m_chpGuid = _getCHPGuid(rte, gd);
00870 
00871   //call-encoding-version=1.0 (ASCII)
00872   //call-encoding-max-alleles=6 (Int32)
00873   //call-encoding-data-size=UCHAR (ASCII)
00874   std::string versionHeader = "call-encoding-version";
00875   std::string maxAllelesHeader = "call-encoding-max-alleles";
00876   std::string dataSizeHeader = "call-encoding-data-size";
00877   std::string version, maxAlleles, dataSize;
00878 
00879   
00880   GenericDataHeader* gdh = gd.Header().GetGenericDataHdr();
00881   
00882   
00883   searchParams(  *gdh, versionHeader, version );
00884   searchParams(  *gdh, maxAllelesHeader, maxAlleles );
00885   searchParams(  *gdh, dataSizeHeader, dataSize );
00886 
00887   Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES, Fs::basename(m_chpExperimentFile) + " " + versionHeader +  ": {" + version + "}" );
00888   Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES, Fs::basename(m_chpExperimentFile) + " " +  maxAllelesHeader + ": {" + maxAlleles +  "}" );
00889   Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES, Fs::basename(m_chpExperimentFile) + " " + dataSizeHeader + ": {" + dataSize+  "}" );
00890 
00891   if ( m_genoCallCoder == NULL ) {
00892     if ( rte.m_adtOpts.m_prototypeCHPFiles ) {
00893       m_genoCallCoder = new GenoCallCoder(6, "UCHAR", "1.0", '/', rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputAnnotationFile);
00894     }
00895     else {
00896       m_genoCallCoder = new GenoCallCoder(atoi(maxAlleles.c_str()), dataSize, version, '/', rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputAnnotationFile);
00897     }
00898 
00899     if ((ttm.getType() == ADT_TRANSLATION_TABLE_TYPE_DMET3) &&  !rte.m_adtOpts.m_ignoreReportAllele) {
00900 
00901       ttm.setReportAlleles( *m_genoCallCoder);
00902     }
00903 
00904     m_chpVersion = version;
00905     m_chpDataEncodingSize = dataSize;
00906     m_chpMaxAlleles = maxAlleles;
00907   }
00908   else if ( ! rte.m_adtOpts.m_prototypeCHPFiles && ((version != m_chpVersion) || (dataSize != m_chpDataEncodingSize) ||  (maxAlleles != m_chpMaxAlleles ) ) ){
00909       Verbose::warn(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, std::string("Conflicting CHP type: ") + Fs::basename(m_chpExperimentFile) + " " + versionHeader +  ": {" + version + "},  " +  maxAllelesHeader + ": {" + maxAlleles +  "}, " + dataSizeHeader + ": {" + dataSize +  "}" );
00910       APT_ERR_ABORT(std::string("CHP files with different versions detected, was expecting: ") + versionHeader + ": {" + m_chpVersion + "}, " + maxAllelesHeader + ": {" + m_chpMaxAlleles + "}, " + dataSizeHeader + ": {" + m_chpDataEncodingSize + "}");
00911 
00912   }
00913 
00914 
00915 
00916   return okToContinue;
00917 
00918 
00919 }
00920 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeNextExperimentCHPFile
00921 /*****************************************************************************/
00922 /*****************************************************************************/
00923 /**
00924  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeTsvColumns
00925  * Synopsis:
00926  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_openTsvFile.
00927  * 
00928  * Initialize the TsvFile object columns from the column definitions.
00929  * The TSV file does not have to be in column order, but this
00930  * method always puts them in column order internally so that
00931  * indexing by column index integer can take place. 
00932  *
00933  *
00934  * @param m_tsvFileName - The name of the TsvFile in question used for messaging.
00935  * @param tsv           - The TsvFile object in question corresponding m_tsvFileName. 
00936  *
00937  * @returns false - on error.
00938  *
00939  */
00940 /*****************************************************************************/
00941 bool TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeTsvColumns(const std::string & inputTsvFileName, affx::TsvFile & tsv)
00942 {
00943 
00944   bool         okTsvColumns = true;
00945   std::stringstream msgSStr;
00946 
00947   m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex.resize(tsv.getColumnCount(0), -1);
00948 
00949 
00950   for (size_t column = 0; column < m_tsvColumnDefinition.size(); column++) {
00951 
00952     // find the tsv column index for this
00953     int tsvColumn
00954     = tsv.cname2cidx(0, m_tsvColumnDefinition[column].m_columnName);
00955 
00956     if (tsvColumn < 0) {
00957       okTsvColumns = false;
00958       msgSStr << inputTsvFileName << ": invalid TsvFile header first-line, ";
00959       msgSStr << "column [" << (column + 1) << "], \"";
00960       msgSStr << m_tsvColumnDefinition[column].m_columnName << "\"  not found." << endl;
00961       continue;
00962     }
00963 
00964     m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]
00965     = m_tsvColumnDefinition[column].m_index;
00966 
00967   }
00968 
00969   if (!okTsvColumns) {
00970     Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, msgSStr.str(), false);
00971   }
00972 
00973   return okTsvColumns;
00974 
00975 }
00976 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_initializeTsvColumns
00977 /*****************************************************************************/
00978 /*****************************************************************************/
00979 /**
00980  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_matchTsvColumnsWithColumnDefinitions
00981  * Synopsis:
00982  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_openTsvFile
00983  *
00984  * It is not normal Affymetrix practice to require to have only the
00985  * set of columns required nor is it normal practice to have those
00986  * columns in any order. The TsvFile object can access columns by
00987  * name independent of order. However, there exists requirements
00988  * for this application to enforce column order as well as column order
00989  * enforce only columns diseried.
00990  * 
00991  * This helper is used to enforce strict column ordering when required.
00992  * Inspect the first line of the TsvFile and insure the appropriate header
00993  * column names exist one-to-one and in the same order
00994  * with all the column definitions. Note this is only required for certain
00995  * files such as the human generated TranslationTable.xls spreadsheet.
00996  *
00997  * @param inputTsvFileName - the Tsv file in question
00998  * @param tsv - the TsvFile object that is opened and corresponds to
00999  *              inputTsvFileName
01000  *
01001  * @return false - the TSV columns are not complete or in column order. 
01002  */
01003 /*****************************************************************************/
01004 bool TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_matchTsvColumnsWithColumnDefinitions(const std::string & inputTsvFileName, affx::TsvFile & tsv)
01005 {
01006 
01007   bool okHeaderLine = true;
01008 
01009   int invalidHeaderCount = 0;
01010 
01011   std::stringstream msgSStr;
01012 
01013   for (size_t i = 0; (i < tsv.getColumnCount(0)) &&
01014        (i < m_tsvColumnDefinition.size()) ; i++) {
01015 
01016     std::string columnName;
01017 
01018     if (tsv.cidx2cname(0, i, columnName) == TSV_OK) {
01019 
01020       if (columnName != m_tsvColumnDefinition[i].m_columnName) {
01021         okHeaderLine = false;
01022         msgSStr << inputTsvFileName << ": invalid TsvFile header first-line, ";
01023         msgSStr << "column [" << (i + 1) << "]: found \"" << columnName << "\" but was expecting \"";
01024         msgSStr << m_tsvColumnDefinition[i].m_columnName << "\"." << endl;
01025         invalidHeaderCount++;
01026       }
01027     } else {
01028 
01029       APT_ERR_ABORT("tsv.cidx2cname returned unexpected error");
01030 
01031     } // if there was a TSV_ERROR
01032 
01033   } // for each column, inspect it
01034 
01035   if (invalidHeaderCount > 0) {
01036     if (invalidHeaderCount < 4) {
01037       Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, msgSStr.str(), false);
01038     } else {
01039       Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, inputTsvFileName + ": invalid TsvFile is missing the header line.", false);
01040     }
01041   }
01042 
01043   return okHeaderLine;
01044 
01045 }
01046 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_matchTsvColumnsWithColumnDefinitions
01047 /*****************************************************************************/
01048 /*****************************************************************************/
01049 /**
01050  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_openTsvFile:
01051  * Synopsis:
01052  * Helper function to the TSV file constructor,
01053  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::TranslationInputStreamTableModel
01054  *
01055  * Opens the Genotype Short Report TSV file, ready to read the first row
01056  * using the streaming readNextExperimentTSV API. Clears any data
01057  * from a previous open. 
01058  *
01059  *
01060  * @param rte - the single instance RunTimeEnviroment.
01061  *
01062  * @return - void, throws an exception on open error.
01063  */
01064 /*****************************************************************************/
01065 void TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_openTsvFile(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte)
01066 {
01067 
01068   // This should never happen unless a new constructor is created
01069   // that doesn't initialize columns.
01070 
01071   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_tsvColumnDefinition.size(), "");
01072 
01073   clearData();
01074 
01075   if (Verbose::getParam().m_Verbosity > ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES) {
01076     Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES, ToStr("### TranslationInputStreamTableModel::readFile('") + m_tsvFileName + "')\n");
01077   }
01078 
01079   //
01080   m_tsv.m_optAutoTrim   = true; // remove '"'s
01081   m_tsv.m_optQuoteChar1 = 0;    // ignore "'"s
01082 
01083   if (m_tsv.open(m_tsvFileName) != TSV_OK) {
01084     APT_ERR_ABORT(m_tsvFileName + ": failed opening input Tsv file.");
01085   }
01086 
01087   bool okColumnDefinitions = true;
01088 
01089   if (m_strictTsvColumnOrder) {
01090     okColumnDefinitions =
01091       _matchTsvColumnsWithColumnDefinitions(m_tsvFileName, m_tsv);
01092   }
01093 
01094   if (okColumnDefinitions) {
01095     okColumnDefinitions = _initializeTsvColumns(m_tsvFileName, m_tsv);
01096   }
01097 
01098   m_tsvColumnCount = m_tsv.getColumnCount(0);
01099   m_tsvRow = 0;
01100 
01101   if (! okColumnDefinitions) {
01102     APT_ERR_ABORT(m_tsvFileName + ": invalid input file detected.");
01103   }
01104 
01105 
01106 
01107   return;
01108 
01109 }
01110 // TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_openTsvFile
01111 /*****************************************************************************/
01112 /*****************************************************************************/
01113 /**
01114  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentCHP:
01115  * Synopsis:
01116  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::readNextExperiment.
01117  *
01118  * Streaming CHP files, where each CHP file is one experiment.
01119  * Read in the entire files worth of experiment gene data.
01120  * Fills in the 'm_rows' table with experiment data. 
01121  *
01122  * This is the place where override data from the override file supplants each
01123  * record of the CHP file as it is read in. This is how translation
01124  * is accomplished via the override file. The override data is
01125  * swapped for the CHP data here. 
01126  *
01127  * 
01128  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment 
01129  * @param ttm - the single instance translation table model
01130  * @param geneExperimentCopyNumberCall
01131  *            - the DMET2 std::map per gene copy number alleles
01132  * @param geneCopyNumber
01133  *            - the DMET3 std::map of gene copy number
01134  * 
01135  * @return - The number for records (markers) read for the experiment.
01136  */
01137 /*****************************************************************************/
01138 int TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentCHP(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, TranslationTableModel & ttm, const std::map<std::string, std::string> &geneExperimentCopyNumberCall, std::map<std::string, int> & geneCopyNumber)
01139 {
01140 
01141   int chpRow       = 0;
01142   int recordsRead  = 0;
01143 
01144   clearData();
01145 
01146   if (!_initializeNextExperimentCHPFile(rte, ttm)) {
01147     return 0;
01148   }
01149 
01150   std::vector< affymetrix_calvin_io::MultiDataType > dataTypes;
01151   dataTypes.push_back(ADT_CHP_DATA_TYPES[BI_TYPE]);
01152   dataTypes.push_back(ADT_CHP_DATA_TYPES[MULTI_TYPE]);
01153 
01154   for (size_t j = 0; j <  dataTypes.size(); j++) {
01155 
01156     for (int i = 0; i < m_chpDataTypeSize[dataTypes[j]] ; i++) {
01157 
01158       affymetrix_calvin_data::DmetBiAllelicData dbad;
01159 
01160       m_chpData->GetEntry(dataTypes[j], i , dbad);
01161 
01162       // Not all probe sets are going to exist in the translation table,
01163       // if not then just drop the probeSet data on the floor.
01164       if (ttm.getProbeSetRowIndex(dbad.name) < 0) {
01165         continue;
01166       }
01167 
01168 
01169       std::string allele1, allele2, originalAllele1, originalAllele2;
01170 
01171       originalAllele1.clear();
01172       originalAllele2.clear();
01173 
01174       if (! _getAllelesFromProbeSet(rte, ttm, dbad, allele1, allele2)) {
01175         continue;
01176       }
01177 
01178       // Genotype Override
01179       if (m_gotm != NULL) {
01180         std::vector< std::string > alleleOverride = m_gotm->getOverrideAlleles(m_experimentName, dbad.name);
01181         if (alleleOverride.size() > 0) {
01182           if ( CallElement::isWildCardBase(allele1)  ) {
01183             m_gotm->m_chpFileProbeSetOriginalBasecall[m_experimentName + "::" + dbad.name] = allele1;
01184           } else {
01185             m_gotm->m_chpFileProbeSetOriginalBasecall[m_experimentName + "::" + dbad.name] = allele1 + "/" + allele2;
01186           }
01187           
01188           originalAllele1 = allele1;
01189           originalAllele2 = allele2;
01190           allele1 = alleleOverride[0];
01191           if ( alleleOverride.size() == 2 ) {
01192             allele2 = alleleOverride[1];
01193           }
01194           else {
01195             allele2 = "";
01196           }
01197         }
01198       }
01199 
01200       std::vector<std::string> newRow;
01201       chpRow++;
01202 
01203       newRow.resize(GT_END_FIELD_INDEX, "");
01204 
01205       newRow[GT_SAMPLE_INDEX]      = "N/A";
01206       newRow[GT_EXPERIMENT_INDEX]  = m_experimentName;
01207       newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]       = _getGeneFromProbeSet(dbad.name, ttm);
01208       newRow[GT_EXTERNAL_ID_INDEX] = _getExternalIdFromProbeSet(dbad.name, ttm);
01209       newRow[GT_PROBE_SET_INDEX]   = dbad.name;
01210       newRow[GT_ALLELE1_INDEX]     = allele1;
01211       newRow[GT_ALLELE2_INDEX]     = allele2;
01212       newRow[GT_ORIGINAL_ALLELE1_INDEX] = originalAllele1;
01213 
01214       newRow[GT_ORIGINAL_ALLELE2_INDEX] = originalAllele2;
01215 
01216       m_fileRowIndex[m_rows.size()] = i;
01217 
01218       recordsRead++;
01219       m_experimentRowIndex[m_experimentName].push_back(chpRow - 1);
01220 
01221       m_probeSetRowIndex[dbad.name] = m_rows.size();
01222       m_rows.push_back(newRow);
01223 
01224       if ( geneCopyNumber.count(newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]) == 0 ) {
01225         geneCopyNumber[newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]] = 2;
01226       }
01227       
01228       if ( allele1  == "0" ) {
01229         geneCopyNumber[newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]]  = 0;
01230       }
01231       else if ( !CallElement::isWildCardBase(allele1) &&
01232                 (geneCopyNumber[newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]] == 2)
01233                 && ( allele2.empty() ) ){
01234         geneCopyNumber[newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX]] = 1;
01235       }
01236     }
01237 
01238   }
01239 
01240 
01241   return recordsRead;
01242 }
01243 // end  TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentCHP
01244 /*****************************************************************************/
01245 /*****************************************************************************/
01246 /**
01247  * TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentTsv
01248  * Synopsis:
01249  * Helper function to TranslationInputStreamTableModel::readNextExperiment.
01250  *
01251  * Stream experiments from the Genotype Short Report file one experiment
01252  * at a time. Fills in the 'm_rows' table with experiment data. 
01253  *
01254  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment. 
01255  * @param ttm  - the single instance translation table model
01256  * @param geneExperimentCopyNumberCall 
01257  *            - the DMET2 std::map of per gene copy number alleles
01258  * @param geneCopyNumber
01259  *            - the DMET3 std::map of gene copy number
01260  * 
01261  * @return - The number for records (markers) read for the experiment.
01262  */
01263 /*****************************************************************************/
01264 int TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readNextExperimentTsv(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, const TranslationTableModel & ttm, const std::map<std::string, std::string> &geneExperimentCopyNumberCall)
01265 {
01266 
01267   bool   okExperimentGene   = true;
01268   int    recordsRead        = 0;
01269   std::string currentExperiment;
01270 
01271   clearData();
01272 
01273   if (m_tsvNextRow.size() > 0) {
01274     currentExperiment = m_tsvNextRow[m_tsvExperimentColumn];
01275     if (m_experimentRowIndex.count(currentExperiment) > 0) {
01276       Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, "\n\nDMET2 genotype short report input files need to be sorted by experiment before they can be input.");
01277       sortTsvFileByExperiment(rte);
01278       APT_ERR_ABORT(currentExperiment + ": duplicate experiment detected.");
01279     }
01280 
01281     m_fileRowIndex[m_rows.size()] = m_tsvRow;
01282     m_rows.push_back(m_tsvNextRow);
01283     m_tsvNextRow.clear();
01284     recordsRead++;
01285   }
01286 
01287   std::string whiteSpace = " ";
01288   bool okColumnValues = true;
01289 
01290 
01291   for (int row = 0; okColumnValues && okExperimentGene &&
01292        (m_tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK); row++) {
01293     //
01294     std::vector<std::string> newRow;
01295     m_tsvRow++;
01296 
01297     newRow.resize(m_tsvColumnCount + 4, "");
01298 
01299     bool okRow = true;
01300 
01301     // Read in a row, one column at a time.
01302     for (int tsvColumn = 0; tsvColumn < m_tsvColumnCount; tsvColumn++) {
01303 
01304       std::stringstream lineSStr;
01305       std::string       columnName = getColumnName(m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]);
01306       // get the data
01307       std::string columnValue;
01308 
01309       if (m_tsv.get(0, tsvColumn, columnValue) != TSV_OK) {
01310         APT_ERR_ABORT("tsv.get != TSV_OK");
01311       }
01312 
01313 
01314       Util::trimString(columnValue, whiteSpace.c_str());
01315 
01316       // empty and allowed?
01317       if (columnValue.empty()) {
01318         if (m_tsvColumnDefinition[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]].m_emptyOk == false) {
01319           lineSStr << m_tsvFileName << ": ROW " << m_tsvRow  << " : ";
01320           lineSStr << columnName << " : ERROR missing required column.";
01321           Verbose::out(rte.m_currentVerbosity, lineSStr.str());
01322           okColumnValues = false;
01323         }
01324       }
01325       // validate it against regexp
01326       else if (!m_tsvColumnDefinition[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]].m_validRE.FullMatch(columnValue)) {
01327         lineSStr << m_tsvFileName << ": ROW " << m_tsvRow  << " : COLUMN [";
01328         lineSStr << tsvColumn << "] " << columnName << " : ERROR invalid value: \"";
01329         lineSStr << columnValue << "\"";
01330         lineSStr << " (expecting " << m_tsvColumnDefinition[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]].m_validRE.pattern();
01331         lineSStr << ")";
01332         lineSStr << endl;
01333 
01334         for (int j = 0 ; j < m_tsvColumnCount;  j++) {
01335           m_tsv.get(0, j, columnValue);
01336           lineSStr << columnValue << ",";
01337         }
01338         Verbose::out(rte.m_currentVerbosity, lineSStr.str());
01339         okColumnValues = false;
01340       }
01341       // Ingore row
01342       else if ((m_tsvColumnDefinition[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]].m_ignoreRE != NULL) &&
01343                (m_tsvColumnDefinition[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]].m_ignoreRE->PartialMatch(columnValue))) {
01344         okRow = false;
01345 
01346       }
01347       // put the column data in our row.
01348       newRow[m_tsvIndexToColumnDefinitionIndex[tsvColumn]] = columnValue;
01349     }
01350     // save our row to the data.
01351 
01352     // Genotype Override
01353     if (m_gotm != NULL) {
01354       std::vector< std::string > override = m_gotm->getOverrideAlleles(newRow[m_tsvExperimentColumn],  newRow[m_tsvProbeSetColumn]);
01355       if (override.size() ) {
01356         cerr << newRow[m_tsvExperimentColumn] << " " << newRow[m_tsvProbeSetColumn] << " has override " << override[0] << endl;
01357         m_gotm->m_chpFileProbeSetOriginalBasecall[newRow[m_tsvExperimentColumn] + "::" + newRow[m_tsvProbeSetColumn]] = newRow[GT_ALLELE1_INDEX];
01358         newRow[GT_ALLELE1_INDEX] = override[0];
01359         newRow[GT_ALLELE2_INDEX] = "";
01360         if ( override.size() == 2 ) {
01361           newRow[GT_ALLELE2_INDEX] = override[1];
01362         }
01363       }
01364     }
01365     // DMET2 Copy Number Zero
01366     if ( ttm.getType() == ADT_TRANSLATION_TABLE_TYPE_DMET3 ) {
01367       std::string key = newRow[GT_GENES_INDEX] + ":" + newRow[GT_EXPERIMENT_INDEX];
01368       if ( geneExperimentCopyNumberCall.count(key) > 0 ) {
01369         newRow[GT_ALLELE1_INDEX] = "0";
01370         newRow[GT_ALLELE2_INDEX] = "";
01371       }
01372         
01373     }
01374     
01375     if (okRow) {
01376 
01377       if (currentExperiment.empty()) {
01378         currentExperiment = newRow[m_tsvExperimentColumn];
01379       }
01380       if (currentExperiment == newRow[m_tsvExperimentColumn]) {
01381         m_fileRowIndex[m_rows.size()] = m_tsvRow;
01382         recordsRead++;
01383         m_experimentRowIndex[currentExperiment].push_back(m_tsvRow - 1);
01384 
01385         m_rows.push_back(newRow);
01386       } else {
01387         m_tsvNextRow = newRow;
01388         okExperimentGene = false;
01389       }
01390     }
01391   }
01392 
01393 
01394   if (! okColumnValues) {
01395     APT_ERR_ABORT(m_tsvFileName + ": invalid input file data detected.");
01396   }
01397 
01398   if (m_rows.size() != recordsRead) {
01399     m_rows.resize(recordsRead);
01400   }
01401 
01402   return recordsRead;
01403 
01404 }
01405 // end TranslationInputStreamTableModel::_readExperimentNextGeneTsv
01406 /*****************************************************************************/
